node.title: Will Elizabeth Holmes Testify in the Theranos Trial?
node.alt: The Theranos founder Elizabeth Holmes, left, and her mother arrived at a courthouse in San JoseÂ on Wednesday.
node.description: The prosecution is expected to wrap its case soon.
node.content: ["The stage is set for what could be the most dramatic moment of the criminal trial of Elizabeth Holmes, founder of the failed start-up Theranos.", "After 11 weeks of court proceedings plagued by delays, prosecutors appear prepared to rest their case soon. Then the defense will be up.", "The defense lawyers\u2019 list of potential witnesses includes Holmes, the former Silicon Valley darling who has pleaded not guilty to multiple counts of wire fraud and faces up to 20 years in prison if convicted.", "\u201cTaking the stand would be a risky move, but Holmes has shown she can be very persuasive and charismatic,\u201d Erin Griffith, a reporter for The New York Times, told me. \u201cAnd she\u2019s clearly a risk-taker.\u201d", "Holmes dropped out of Stanford and started the blood-testing start-up Theranos at age 19. For years she convinced big-name investors of her company\u2019s promise. At one point, Theranos was valued at $9 billion.", "But she and the company fell from grace after claims about its technology were shown to be false. Her downfall has captured the public imagination and spawned a documentary, book and podcast \u2014 and a mini-series based on that podcast.", "Holmes, now 37 and a new mother, has been in the courtroom every day during the trial, but jurors have yet to hear her speak outside of recordings played as evidence. Her face is covered by a mask. And she sits so still that a courtroom artist said she\u2019s particularly easy to sketch.", "The Times reporter Erin Woo told me that she thought a key piece of the defense\u2019s case might require Holmes to take the stand.", "Holmes\u2019s lawyers are expected to argue that she was manipulated by Sunny Balwani, Theranos\u2019s former chief operating officer and Holmes\u2019s former boyfriend. In court filings, Holmes has said Balwani, who faces a separate trial next year, was emotionally abusive and controlling.", "But jurors so far haven\u2019t heard much of this argument. And former Theranos employees are unlikely to be able to shed light on Holmes\u2019s private life with Balwani, Woo told me.", "\u201cThe two of them kept their relationship secret during their time at Theranos,\u201d Woo said. \u201cIt seems like Holmes herself may have to testify to their relationship if her team wants jurors to understand what the inner workings of it were like.\u201d", "For more:", "Drug overdose deaths soared during the pandemic, especially in California.", "Salted peanuts in these cookies result in a delightfully salty-sweet treat.", "Today\u2019s tip comes from Meg Waite Clayton, who recommends visiting California\u2019s independent bookstores:", "Tell us about your favorite places to visit in California.
